Module nl.naturalis.common
Package nl.naturalis.common.io

Class UnsafeByteArrayOutputStream

java.lang.Object
java.io.OutputStream
nl.naturalis.common.io.UnsafeByteArrayOutputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable, Flushable, AutoCloseable
public class UnsafeByteArrayOutputStream extends OutputStream
An output stream in which the data is written into a byte array. The buffer automatically grows as data is written to it. Contrary to Java's own ByteArrayOutputStream, the internal byte array is exposed to the client via getBackingArray(). Note, however, that you must therefore use getBackingArray() in combination with the size() method to extract the "live" bytes - e.g new String(out.toArray(), 0, out.count()).

This class also lets you specify how to increase the size of the byte array once it reaches full capacity.

Closing a ByteArrayOutputStream has no effect. The methods in this class can be called after the stream has been closed without generating an IOException.

  • Constructor Details

    • UnsafeByteArrayOutputStream

      public UnsafeByteArrayOutputStream()
      Creates a new UnsafeByteArrayOutputStream. The buffer capacity is initially 512 bytes, though its size increases if necessary. When it reaches full capacity its replaced with a buffer twice its size.

    • UnsafeByteArrayOutputStream

      public UnsafeByteArrayOutputStream (int capacity)
      Creates a new UnsafeByteArrayOutputStream. The buffer initially has the specified number of bytes. When it reaches full capacity its replaced with a buffer twice its size.
      Parameters:
      capacity - The initial buffer capacity

    • UnsafeByteArrayOutputStream

      public UnsafeByteArrayOutputStream (byte[] buf, int offset)
      Creates a new UnsafeByteArrayOutputStream that wraps around the specified byte array. When it reaches full capacity its replaced with a buffer twice its size.
      Parameters:
      buf - The initial byte array to write to
      offset - The offset of the first byte to write.The offset may be equal to the byte array's length (causing write actions to append to what is already in the array) but not greater.

    • UnsafeByteArrayOutputStream

      public UnsafeByteArrayOutputStream (int size, float expandBy, ExpansionType expansionType)
      Creates a new UnsafeByteArrayOutputStream. The buffer capacity is initially size bytes, though its size increases if necessary.
      Parameters:
      size - The initial length of the byte array
      expandBy - The amount by which the increase the size of the byte array when it reach full capacity
      expansionType - The type of expansion. Whichever expandBy value and ExpansionType you choose, the buffer capacity will always be increased enough to sustain the next write action.

    • UnsafeByteArrayOutputStream

      public UnsafeByteArrayOutputStream (byte[] buf, int offset, float expandBy, ExpansionType expansionType)
      Creates a new UnsafeByteArrayOutputStream that wraps around the specified byte array.
      Parameters:
      buf - The initial byte array to write to
      offset - The offset of the first byte to write. The offset may be equal to the byte array's length (causing write actions to append to what is already in the array) but not greater.
      expandBy - The amount by which the increase the size of the byte array when it reaches full capacity
      expansionType - The type of expansion. Whichever expandBy value and ExpansionType you choose, the buffer capacity will always be increased enough to sustain the next write action.

    • write

      public void write (byte[] b, int off, int len)
      Writes len bytes from the specified byte array starting at offset off to this ExposedByteArrayOutputStream.
      Overrides:
      write in class OutputStream
      Parameters:
      b - the data
      off - the start offset in the data
      len - the number of bytes to write

    • writeTo

      public void writeTo (OutputStream out) throws IOException
      Writes the complete contents of this ByteArrayOutputStream to the specified output stream argument, as if by calling the output stream's write method using out.write(buf, 0, count).
      Parameters:
      out - the output stream to which to write the data.
      Throws:
      IOException - if an I/O error occurs.

    • getBackingArray

      public byte[] getBackingArray()
      Returns the backing array for this instance (not a copy of it). Note that you must use this method in combination withthe size() method to retrieve the bytes that were actually written to this instance.
      Returns:

    • toByteArray

      public byte[] toByteArray()
      Returns the bytes that were written to this instance in a new byte array.
      Returns:

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of bytes written to this instance.
      Returns:

    • reset

      public void reset()
      Resets the byte count to zero, so that all currently accumulated output in the output stream is discarded. The output stream can be used again, reusing the already allocated buffer space.

    • close

      public void close()
      Closing a ByteArrayOutputStream has no effect. The methods in this class can be called after the stream has been closed without generating an IOException.
      Specified by:
      close in interface AutoCloseable
      Specified by:
      close in interface Closeable
      Overrides:
